decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate plenty of mana and cast powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes cards like Expedition Map, Ancient Stirrings, and Sylvan Scrying to help find the needed pieces quickly. With a mix of removal spells like Dismember and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its high-powered threats.

The deck focuses on using a combination of powerful planeswalkers, disruptive hand disruption spells, and efficient removal to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. By using cards like Liliana of the Veil and Dark Confidant to disrupt the opponent's hand and generate card advantage, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to deal with threats, the deck aims to dominate the early game and close out the match quickly with threats like Tarmogoyf and Raging Ravine.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful land spells like Scapeshift and Hour of Promise to quickly assemble Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with enough Mountains to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Utilizing cards like Prismatic Omen to ensure all lands are Mountains and searching for key pieces like Primeval Titan, the deck aims to combo off and win the game in a single turn. Additionally, cards like Lightning Bolt and Relic of Progenitus provide interaction and disruption against opponents trying to disrupt the combo.

This deck focuses on the synergy and strength of Human tribal creatures, utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to quickly build a threatening board presence. By leveraging cards such as Reflector Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt opponents' strategies, combined with disruption spells like Path to Exile, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control throughout the game. With the ability to quickly flood the board with creatures and efficiently deal with threats, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive gameplay.

The main concept of this Modern deck is to disrupt opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Thalia and Leonin Arbiter while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Blade Splicer and Restoration Angel. Using cards like Path to Exile and Ghost Quarter to control the board and mana base. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed. The deck aims to slow down opponents while building a strong board presence to overwhelm them.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Gideon. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while eventually overwhelming them with card advantage from cards like Serum Visions and Sphinx's Revelation. The use of land destruction and recursion with Crucible of Worlds also adds another layer of control to the deck. Mana denial and versatile removal options make it difficult for opponents to develop their board, while the planeswalkers provide win conditions and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan combo to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. By searching for and playing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan, the player can trigger Valakut's ability multiple times in a single turn, dealing incremental damage to the opponent and clearing the path for a swift victory. The deck also includes additional ramp and control elements to support the combo and protect the player's life total until they can assemble their win condition.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing significant damage. Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust provide additional disruption and removal options, while Walking Ballista and Endbringer offer versatility and repeated value. The deck also features mana acceleration with Eldrazi Temple and Tron lands, allowing for powerful plays early in the game. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure and control the game with its aggressive Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's draws and plays through cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, Ensnaring Bridge, and Engineered Explosives. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Collective Brutality, and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck can search for key pieces with Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings, while also providing some recursion with Academy Ruins and Inventors' Fair. The mana base is designed to support the deck's colored requirements and ability to cast its spells efficiently.

The key premise of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, along with big threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. By assembling the UrzaTron land combo (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower), the deck aims to ramp quickly into its high-cost threats while using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Expedition Map to find the necessary pieces. With removal spells like Collective Brutality and Fatal Push, as well as board wipes like Oblivion Stone, the deck can efficiently control the board and win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a board presence of artifact creatures, pump them up with equipment, and attack aggressively to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Spire of Industry and Mox Opal to power out threats like Vault Skirge, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager. Cranial Plating provides a powerful boost to creatures, while Etched Champion and Master of Etherium provide additional benefits to the artifact-heavy strategy. The goal is to quickly deal damage and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this Lantern Control deck is to lock down the opponent's options and control the game through disruption and manipulation of their deck. Using cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Ensnaring Bridge, the deck aims to deny the opponent any meaningful draws or plays while also controlling the board with artifacts like Pithing Needle and Engineered Explosives. With efficient mana production from Mox Opal and Whir of Invention to fetch key pieces, the deck looks to grind out the opponent and win through attrition and resource denial.

The deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently by utilizing Eldrazi Temples and Urza lands for ramp. Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer disrupt opponents' game plans while Reality Smasher and Walking Ballista provide aggressive threats. With a mix of removal, card draw, and big finishers like All Is Dust and Karn Liberated, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures and disruption spells. The key strategy is to maintain board control and pressure opponents with a steady stream of Eldrazi threats while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on efficiently generating mana and casting a high number of spells in a single turn to generate a lethal Storm count and win the game with cards like Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens. It utilizes cards like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to increase mana production, while Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer reduce the cost of spells. Gifts Ungiven helps tutor for key combo pieces, while Past in Flames allows for spell recursion. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its decisive burst of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with cheap artifact creatures and then power them up with equipment like Cranial Plating to deal massive amounts of damage early in the game. The synergy between cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Signal Pest allows for explosive turns where the player can overwhelm their opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is optimized for quick and efficient casting of spells, with a focus on maximizing the affinity mechanic to get ahead on board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Street Wraith, Faithless Looting, and Cathartic Reunion in order to utilize graveyard mechanics like Dredge. By doing so, the deck can quickly bring back creatures like Vengevine and Hollow One while also enabling powerful spells like Become Immense and Temur Battle Rage. The deck aims to be aggressive and explosive, overwhelming the opponent with a fast-paced strategy that takes advantage of the graveyard as a resource.
